review: I downloaded this app three days ago in the midst of a panic attack. I used the rootr button and went through the prompts a few times until I felt a bit calmer. There is not much that can help me when I’m in the middle of a panic attack as badly as that one, so the fact that it brought me even a little but ofpeace helped. It was especially helpful to be reminded that I have survived every other panic attack, something that is easy to overlook in the midst of one! I also love the journal feature, it makes it easy to keep track of my panic attacks and also look at the good aspects of my day as well. Unfortunately, due to financial reasons, I don’t have the means of upgrading to the premium version but I would definitely look into that if my situation was different. The developers definitely deserve it. The only suggestion I have is to add a few more helpful reminders while using the rootr button. I went through it three times before I felt calm and the sayings started to lose the effect after the first time. Other than that, great app!

title: Grounding

review:
I’m new to this app, but here are my top points so far

- The breathr tool—the visualized breathing thing helps, especially during anxiety. The free version of the app only allows one-minute increments, but there is no amount limit to how many times you can do the one-minute ones (that I know of yet)

- the Rootr tool—this did help me during a panic attack. Although, if you keep having a panic attack, it gives the option to call your contact person. I didn’t have this set up, but seeing that option come up during a panic attack did give me anxiety because I didn’t want to call someone at night. Granted, like I said, I didn’t have that option set up... but the panicked mind doesn’t think logically.

I think it’s a useful and good app overall. It’s worth a try, there’s plenty that you can access even on the free version.

But note to the developers: another review mentioned adding games: this is a good idea because distracting the brain/doing tasks that require thinking helps me personally with panic attacks.

review:
I have panic attacks semi consistently so every couple days to up to 7 in one day. One time I really wanted some help with it of them and found this app. (I can’t get medical help at this moment sadly) I conscientiously used this app for the first time during one of my worst attacks lasting more than an hour and just being able to listen to the facts helped. I like how when using it during an actual panic attack it is really easy to just continue with just one button to press. It helped a lot at first but slowly the effect of telling the facts did nothing for me. There are not too many and they get old after a while. I find myself just not believing them at all now. I wish there was a little more that could help someone during a panic attack. I tried to then use it to just keep track of the panic attacks but it seems like it doesn’t count the panic attack if you go through it semi quickly. I think this is to stop people from farming them and being able to brag about getting through however many panic attacks but that’s not really a thing that someone would do with something like this. There are some features that cost money but something like this doesn’t seem like it should but I’m ok that they are there because it is a whole lot better than an add popping up when you are suffering.

UPDATE: an update just came out and have seemed to fix the issue of some panic attacks not being recorded.

UPDATE 2: when you finally are able to be confident enough to be able to go to the orange button (don’t know what to call it exactly) almost 200 panic attacks in it feels so good to actually beat it that way. It helps a lot and even though I can’t do it every time it is so helpful and feels so good.

review:
I can only speak on my experiences, so I love this app! The content of this app, it has helped me through a very stressful and anxious week. For some reason this week alone I’ve had daily panic attacks, but this app has helped tremendously with relief. I love the factual information they send you with the panic button. I can’t recall what I already know when I’m in a panic state; I lose all sense of reasoning and fact finding, so reading the information in this app helps a lot with returning to a coherent calm state, and reminding me of what I already know about panic attacks. 

My favorite part is Rootd’s push to help you overcome and understand your anxiety issues from a root cause level, rather than just a quick fix. When on the purchased version they provide tools to help you investigate and resolve your root issues. This helped me identify several causes of my panic attacks from this week, and I see some long term patterns that have been toxic in my life. I am starting to build confidence and feel in control again! 

So now the reason for 4 stars instead of 5:

I ran into a snag with the purchase. I bought this on my laptop, and the directions said to open up the app on my mobile and restore purchase. It didn’t work. I tried multiple times across multiple days. After three days of no success I contacted support through the website contact form. No response, ever. I finally found the email to contact the company directly through my emailed receipt. Once I got in touch, they validated my purchase and unlocked the premium content on my account. Phew! 
BTW, they are very friendly and helpful, they just need to fix their website. Thanks Rootd!!!

review:
I’ve searched for a good “anxiety helping” app FOREVER. Finally my therapist recommended this one, so far I really love it, I love the breathing, body scans and rape silly love the panic attack facts! I love that it can read them out loud or you can read them, these are all thoughtful details for things we may need during times we’re not thinking straight! I also love that I can use this on my Apple Watch, although I’m having some trouble with it freezing up, but I think the bugs can be fixed!

Some suggestions: I would love an open writing journal section along with the guided questions! Also just a few kinks with the Apple Watch use working smoothly. I would also love the option to text my SOS person from the app as well, maybe some already written out statements, so it’s an easy click! Part of my treatment plan With my therapist is to text (not call) an SOS to a chosen friend to encourage me to do my breathing exercise when I’m feeling too out of control in a panic attack, so this is amazing! 

I haven’t gotten to try the full version yet, I would love a free trial period because if this is fitting for me I would definitely purchase it!

Original Review: I love the idea and direction of this app...
That being said, I used the Rootr tool (big red button) in a calm positive state, and it sent me straight to an anxiety attack. Statements to the effect of “feel the anxiety and invite it to come back again” and “feel how your chest tightens and ask for more” are horribly triggering. I understand the point is to overcome anxiety by not allowing it to take control of me, but I found these prompts or statements counterproductive to conquering my anxiety.
Also, the little monster face on the app icon looks terribly stressed out and is not so inviting for me to use when I’m struggling.
I am going to keep the app for now and keep an eye on any changes or updates.
I really wanted to send this to a good friend of mine, but as it is now I am worried it would cause more harm than help.
